hints.content:
When we add a number, we jump that distance to the right on the number line.

To show $\blueD{5}+\blueD{5}+\blueD{5}+\blueD{5}+\blueD{5}+\blueD{5}$, we need to show $\maroonD{6}$ jumps of $\blueD{5}$ units.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 30 with tick marks at 0, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, and 30. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to each tick mark. Each arrow is labeled plus 5. !

hints.content:
This number line best represents $6\times 5$:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 30 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, and 30. !

choices.content: ![A number line labeled 0 to 30 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, and 30.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/eb48604e32efdcb9c6c468466a0bfdc2bfde846b)

![A number line labeled 0 to 11 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 6 and 11.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6e480622270c258cbf6efbb76b6ac3e3aca51373)

![A number line labeled 0 to 36 with tick marks at every 1 unit. An arrow begins at the 0 tick mark and moves right on the number line, pointing to the labeled tick marks at 6, 12, 18, 24, 30, and 36.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5ac3e7cdefec4caf3a11b451104c28c18305df2d)
